definitions.definition: a person who studies or writes about philosophy

examples.text: We studied the writings of the Greek philosopher Aristotle.
a talk by a distinguished moral philosopher
the great philosophers of ancient Greece
He was a fine writer, historian and philosopher.
Was Marx a political, social or historical philosopher?
Whiteside was highly esteemed as an experimental philosopher.

phrases: a philosopher of religion, science, etc.

definitions.definition: a person who thinks deeply about things

examples.text: He seems to be a bit of a philosopher.
Many of her followers regarded her as a true philosopher.

wordOrigin: Middle English: from a variant of Old French philosophe, via Latin from Greek philosophos ‘lover of wisdom’, from philein ‘to love’ + sophos ‘wise’.
